newsitem.title: HONG KONG: China Eastern Hong Kong IPO to run from Jan 28-31.
newsitem.headline: China Eastern Hong Kong IPO to run from Jan 28-31.

text.p: The initial public offer (IPO) of shares in China Eastern Airlines in Hong Kong is expected to run from January 28 to 31 and dealing in the shares is seen beginning on February 5, market sources said on Friday.

China Eastern is expected to issue 140 million H-shares in its Hong Kong flotation, or 10 percent of its global offering of 1.4 billion H-shares, at a price ranging from HK$1.24 to HK$1.39 per share, sources said.
The issue price, representing a price to earnings (P.E.) multiple of 9.7 to 10.9 times, is expected to be fixed on January 31, sources said.
H-shares are shares in Chinese enterprises listed on the Hong Kong stock exchange.

"The airline is expected to raise about HK$1.56 billion in its (global) IPO, with 65 percent of the proceeds used for fleet expansion and 35 percent for capital expenditure," one analyst said after a listing presentation on Friday.
China Eastern said earlier it expected to sell its American Depositary Shares (ADS) at US$16 to US$18 per ADS. The ADS issue represents 1.26 billion H-shares.
The airline forecasts its earnings to be about US$66 million for the year ended December 1996, down from US$76 million in 1995, sources said.
Analysts said China Eastern would be the first Chinese airline seeking an H-share listing in Hong Kong.
Morgan Stanley is expected to be the global co-ordinator of the issue, they said.
